comments:
2.2M3, also with I200511240817.

I have a .genmodel and .ecore (the genmodel was originally created from the ecore) in a project in my workspace. It depends on ecore, xsd, ecore, and wsdl (from the web tools project) and two other ecores in my same project. I'm now in this state where I get an NPE upon (a) opening the .genmodel, and also (b) trying to reload the genmodel from ecore. This is a major problem because I'm stuck now - can't update my model. The UI gives me absolutely no indication an error has occurred, which is also bad. I got in this state using the emf tools, which is also bad.

NPE is here. Any workaround would be appreciated.

Ed's null-guard fix is in CVS, and has been picked up in build I200511291121.

I'm going to mark this bug fixed; please reopen it and attach your test case if necessary.

I've debugged this, and as you suspected it was a missing genmodel file (since the references are all hardcoded file paths and unless you have the files in exactly the same place as the original author, you're kind of screwed).

The *real* problem here is that the EMF codegen knows exactly what the problem is, and doesn't tell me. This is really really frustrating and has cost me a lot of time on more than one occasion.

When encountering this problem, instead of simply hiding the NPE, the codegen must inform the user of the missing file and where it is referenced from. This information is readily accessible to the codegen. Hiding the problem will simply cause things to break later and the user still has no idea why.
I'll try the fix out, from talking to Ed this is exactly what the fix should do - thanks guys
*** Bug 120160 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
